about_the_game:
In "The Last Shift", you find yourself tasked with patrolling the dimly lit corridors of an allegedly haunted hotel undergoing renovation. As the night progresses, each patrol becomes a terrifying experience of psychological horror. Are the ghostly apparitions and unexplained sounds real, or is the isolation of the night playing with your senses !?

Key Features:


Immersive Horror Experience: Navigate through a tension-filled environment, where the line between the supernatural and psychological horror blurs.

Evolving Gameplay: Each patrol introduces new, spine-chilling occurrences, building to a terrifying climax.

Discover a Dark Mystery: Uncover the sinister history of the hotel through environmental storytelling and eerie clues.

Survival Tactics: Manage your resources wisely, including flashlight batteries, and make crucial decisions under pressure.

Stunning Visuals and Sound Design: Experience the haunting atmosphere of the hotel, brought to life with detailed graphics and a disturbing soundscape.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 or AMD FX 8350
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 or AMD Radeon R9 290 or Intel Arc A380
  • Storage: 16 GB available space

name: Dark Dimensions: The Last Shift

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 or AMD FX 8350
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 or AMD Radeon R9 290 or Intel Arc A380
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 16 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: SSD (Preferred)
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4590 or AMD FX 8350
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 or AMD Radeon R9 290 or Intel Arc A380
  • Additional Notes: SSD (Preferred)

short_description: Embark on a chilling journey, a suspense-filled horror game set within the eerie confines of an old hotel. your role as the night watchman a single unforgettable night, question the reality of your surroundings: are the horrors you face truly haunted manifestations or merely the tricks of your mind?
